intro: Anisoptera vidaliana, commonly known as the narrow-leafed hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Anisoptera vidaliana is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms and attractive foliage.
